pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:5.1: 15. The training rule on leaving without telling
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.2: At that time a certain nun was associating with a family from which she received a regular meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.3: One morning, after robing up, she took her bowl and robe, and went to that family, where she sat down on a seat. She then left without telling the lay people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.4: Soon afterwards a slave-woman was sweeping the house and she put that seat in between some vessels.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.5: Not seeing the seat, the people there asked that nun,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.8: “Venerable, give back the seat.” And after scolding her, they made an end of her regular meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:6.9: Then, while those people were cleaning the house, they saw that seat in between the vessels. They then asked that nun for forgiveness and restored her regular meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.1: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.3: “How can a nun visit a family before the meal, sit down on a seat, and then depart without telling the lay people?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.7: How can a nun visit a family before the meal, sit down on a seat, and then depart without telling the lay people?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:8.1: ‘If a nun visits families before the meal, sits down on a seat, and then leaves without telling the lay people, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:11.2: there are four kinds of families: aristocratic families, brahmin families, merchant families, worker families.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:12.2: a place for sitting cross-legged is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:13.1: Leaves without telling the lay people:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:13.2: if, without telling a person in that family who understands, she goes beyond the roof-cover of that house, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:13.3: If it is out in the open and she goes beyond the vicinity of the seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:14.1: If she has not told, and she does not perceive that she has, and she leaves, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:14.2: If she has not told, but she is unsure of it, and she leaves, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:14.3: If she has not told, but she perceives that she has, and she leaves, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:15.1: If it is not a place for sitting cross-legged, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:15.2: If she has told, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:15.3: If she has told, but she is unsure if she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:15.4: If she has told, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:16.3: if the seat is not movable;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:16.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:17.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
